00012   "$Id: 3884656adfb278af41423d4df4826b1b928f55f1 $"

00014 #include <string>
00015 #include <vector>
00016 #include <GeographicLib/Constants.hpp>
00017 #include <GeographicLib/CircularEngine.hpp>
00018 
00019 namespace GeographicLib {
00020 
00021   /**
00022    * \brief Geomagnetic field on a circle of latitude
00023    *
00024    * Evaluate the earth's magnetic field on a circle of constant height and
00025    * latitude.  This uses a CircleEngine to pre-evaluate the inner sum of the
00026    * spherical harmonic sum, allowing the values of the field at several
00027    * different longitudes to be evaluated rapidly.
00028    *
00029    * Use MagneticModel::Circle to create a MagneticCircle object.  (The
00030    * constructor for this class is private.)
00031    *
00032    * Example of use:
00033    * \include example-MagneticCircle.cpp
00034    **********************************************************************/
00035 
00036   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT MagneticCircle {
00037   private:
00038     typedef Math::real real;
00039 
00040     real _a, _f, _lat, _h, _t, _cphi, _sphi, _t1, _dt0;
00041     bool _interpolate;
00042     CircularEngine _circ0, _circ1;
00043 
00044     MagneticCircle(real a, real f, real lat, real h, real t,
00045                    real cphi, real sphi, real t1, real dt0,
00046                    bool interpolate,
00047                    const CircularEngine& circ0, const CircularEngine& circ1)
00048       : _a(a)
00049       , _f(f)
00050       , _lat(lat)
00051       , _h(h)
00052       , _t(t)
00053       , _cphi(cphi)
00054       , _sphi(sphi)
00055       , _t1(t1)
00056       , _dt0(dt0)
00057       , _interpolate(interpolate)
00058       , _circ0(circ0)
00059       , _circ1(circ1)
00060     {}
00061 
00062     void Field(real lon, bool diffp,
00063                real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz,
00064                real& Bxt, real& Byt, real& Bzt) const throw();
00065 
00066     friend class MagneticModel; // MagneticModel calls the private constructor
00067 
00068   public:
00069 
00070     /**
00071      * A default constructor for the normal gravity.  This sets up an
00072      * uninitialized object which can be later replaced by the
00073      * MagneticModel::Circle.
00074      **********************************************************************/
00075     MagneticCircle() : _a(-1) {}
00076 
00077     /** \name Compute the magnetic field
00078      **********************************************************************/
00079     ///@{
00080     /**
00081      * Evaluate the components of the geomagnetic field at a particular
00082      * longitude.
00083      *
00084      * @param[in] lon longitude of the point (degrees).
00085      * @param[out] Bx the easterly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00086      * @param[out] By the northerly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00087      * @param[out] Bz the vertical (up) component of the magnetic field
00088      *   (nanotesla).
00089      **********************************************************************/
00090     void operator()(real lon, real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz) const throw() {
00091       real dummy;
00092       Field(lon, false, Bx, By, Bz, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00093     }
00094 
00095     /**
00096      * Evaluate the components of the geomagnetic field and their time
00097      * derivatives at a particular longitude.
00098      *
00099      * @param[in] lon longitude of the point (degrees).
00100      * @param[out] Bx the easterly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00101      * @param[out] By the northerly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00102      * @param[out] Bz the vertical (up) component of the magnetic field
00103      *   (nanotesla).
00104      * @param[out] Bxt the rate of change of \e Bx (nT/yr).
00105      * @param[out] Byt the rate of change of \e By (nT/yr).
00106      * @param[out] Bzt the rate of change of \e Bz (nT/yr).
00107      **********************************************************************/
00108     void operator()(real lon, real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz,
00109                     real& Bxt, real& Byt, real& Bzt) const throw() {
00110       Field(lon, true, Bx, By, Bz, Bxt, Byt, Bzt);
00111     }
00112     ///@}
00113 
00114     /** \name Inspector functions
00115      **********************************************************************/
00116     ///@{
00117     /**
00118      * @return true if the object has been initialized.
00119      **********************************************************************/
00120     bool Init() const throw() { return _a > 0; }
00121     /**
00122      * @return \e a the equatorial radius of the ellipsoid (meters).  This is
00123      *   the value inherited from the MagneticModel object used in the
00124      *   constructor.
00125      **********************************************************************/
00126     Math::real MajorRadius() const throw()
00127     { return Init() ? _a : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00128     /**
00129      * @return \e f the flattening of the ellipsoid.  This is the value
00130      *   inherited from the MagneticModel object used in the constructor.
00131      **********************************************************************/
00132     Math::real Flattening() const throw()
00133     { return Init() ? _f : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00134     /**
00135      * @return the latitude of the circle (degrees).
00136      **********************************************************************/
00137     Math::real Latitude() const throw()
00138     { return Init() ? _lat : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00139     /**
00140      * @return the height of the circle (meters).
00141      **********************************************************************/
00142     Math::real Height() const throw()
00143     { return Init() ? _h : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00144     /**
00145      * @return the time (fractional years).
00146      **********************************************************************/
00147     Math::real Time() const throw()
00148     { return Init() ? _t : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00149 
00150     ///@}
00151   };
00152 
00153 } // namespace GeographicLib
00154 
00155 #endif  // GEOGRAPHICLIB_MAGNETICCIRCLE_HPP
